description: 0..1 (recommended) x string: description
Storage location for this file
Age in days of participant at time of biospecimen collection
Age in days at which phenotype was assigned
Age in days at which phenotype was recorded
Age of last vital status
Method by which Container is stored (e.g. -80C freezer, Liquid nitrogen, etc.)
Identifier for the eldest sample in a lineage of processed, pooled, or aliquoted samples. This may be the same as Parent Sample ID or Sample ID (if no processing was performed).
Type of biological material comprising the collected sample (e.g. Whole blood, Bone marrow, Saliva, etc.)
Identifier for specific container/aliquot of sample, if applicable. For example, distinct aliquots of a sample will have the same Sample ID but different Container IDs.
Type of access control on this file, determined by DCC
General category of data in file (e.g. Clinical, Genomics, Proteomics, Metabolomics, Immune maps, Transcriptomics, etc.)

Specific type of data contained in file (e.g. Aligned reads, Unaligned reads, SNV, CNV, Gene fusions, Isoform expression, Gene expression quantification, Structural variations, Cytokine profiles, Operation reports, Pathology reports, Histology images, Clinical supplement, Protein expression quantification, etc.)
dbGaP study accession code
ICD-10 code (annotated by data contributor or DCC)
Mondo disease ontology code (annotated by data contributor or DCC)
NCI Thesaurus code (annotated by data contributor or DCC)
Diagnosis as described by data contributor
How diagnosis was assigned
Down Syndrome status of participant (T21 = Trisomy 21; D21 = Disomy 21, euploid)
Ethnicity of participant
Experimental method used to obtain data in file (e.g. WGS, RNAseq, WXS, SOMAscan, Mass spec proteomics, LCMS metabolomics, Multiplex immunoassay, Meso Scale Discovery, etc.)
Unique identifier for the participant, assigned by data contributor
Unique identifer for family to which Participant belongs
Relationship of Participant to other family members

Structure of family members participating in the study (proband-only = no family members participating; duo = proband + parent; trio = proband + 2 parents; trio+ = proband + 2 parents + other relatives)
Participant ID for Participant's father
File identifier, assigned by DCC
Synapse ID for file
Format of file (e.g. bam, cram, vcf, csv, html, png, fastq, pdf, dicom, etc.)

Link to a Participant
Link to a Study
Procedure by which Sample was derived from Parent Sample (e.g. RBC lysis, Centrifugation, Ficoll, etc.)
Participant ID for Participant's mother
Name of file, assigned by data contributor
Whether participant is alive or dead
Identifier for the direct parent from which Sample was derived, processed, pooled, etc. (if applicable)
Type of biological material comprising the parent sample (e.g. Plasma, Serum, White blood cells, etc.)
Unique identifier for the participant, assigned by DCC
Human Phenotype Ontology code (annotated by data contributor or DCC)
Whether phenotype was observed or not
Phenotype as described by data contributor
Funding source for the study
Race of participant
Whether or not the sample is potentially available for sharing through the Virtual Biorepository
Identifier for sample. A sample is a unique biological material; two samples with two different IDs are biologically distinct.
